org.statefulj.framework.core.annotations

Annotation Type Transition


  • @Target(value=METHOD)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Documented
 @Component
public @interface Transition
    A Transition is a reaction to an Event directed at a Stateful Entity. The Transition can involve a possible change in State and a possible Action. If you want to map multiple Transitions to a method, encapsulate the Transition annotation with a Transitions annotation. If you want to change State without invoking a method, include the Transition within the StatefulController.noops() field
    Author:
    Andrew Hall

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Fields and Description
      static String ANY_STATE

      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String from
      Defines the "from" State.
      boolean reload
      Defines whether to reload the Stateful Entity before invoking the method.
      String to
      Defines to the "to" State.

    • Field Detail

      • ANY_STATE

        public static final String ANY_STATE

    • Element Detail

      • event

        public abstract String event
        Defines the Event
        Returns:
        the event

      • from

        public abstract String from
        Defines the "from" State. A value of "*" implies that any State qualifies as a "from" State
        Returns:
        the "from" State value
        Default:
        "*"

      • to

        public abstract String to
        Defines to the "to" State. A value of "*" implies that the "to" state is the value of the current State
        Returns:
        the "to" State value
        Default:
        "*"

      • reload

        public abstract boolean reload
        Defines whether to reload the Stateful Entity before invoking the method. Set to true to manage potential concurrency conflicts
        Returns:
        If true, will reload the Stateful Entity before invoking the method
        Default:
        false
